emerging_technologies.name: Quantum Machine Learning
emerging_technologies.description: Leveraging quantum computing to perform machine learning operations exponentially faster than classical computers.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could revolutionize fields requiring high computational power, but raises concerns about job displacement and data privacy.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Dependent on the development of stable, error-corrected quantum computers and new quantum algorithms.

emerging_technologies.name: Neuromorphic Computing
emerging_technologies.description: Hardware that mimics the neural structure of the human brain to perform computations more efficiently.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promises lower energy consumption and could lead to more intelligent, autonomous systems; ethical concerns about AI decision-making.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Challenges include scaling up production and integration with current digital systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs)
emerging_technologies.description: Organizations managed by rules encoded as computer programs on the blockchain, rather than by people.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Offers new models for democratic decision-making but poses regulatory and legal challenges.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption depends on regulatory acceptance, user trust in smart contracts, and integration with existing legal frameworks.

emerging_technologies.name: Space-Based Solar Power
emerging_technologies.description: Collecting solar power in space for transmission to Earth to provide continuous, clean energy.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could dramatically reduce reliance on fossil fuels but involves high initial costs and geopolitical issues.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires advancements in space technology, energy transmission, and international cooperation.

mainstream_technologies.name: Autonomous Delivery Drones
mainstream_technologies.description: Drones capable of delivering packages autonomously, improving logistics efficiency.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread in urban areas with regulatory frameworks for drone airspace management.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Driven Personal Health Assistants
mainstream_technologies.description: AI systems that monitor health metrics and provide personalized health advice.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Integrated into daily life, with high acceptance due to proven health outcomes and privacy regulations.

epoch_themes.description: A global push towards technologies that reduce environmental impact and promote sustainability.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes a shift in lifestyle, economy, and policy towards sustainability, with potential job shifts towards green industries.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Rising environmental awareness, international climate agreements, and investments in renewable energy.

epoch_themes.description: Increasing focus on privacy, data control, and the decentralization of digital services.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Empowers individuals with control over their data, challenges traditional governance models, and could lead to new forms of digital citizenship.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Regulatory changes for data protection, growth of decentralized apps, and public demand for transparency in digital services.
